verses.verse: How <WH349> does the city <WH5892> sit <WH3427> solitary, <WH910> that was full <WH7227> of people! <WH5971> how is she become <WH1961> as a widow! <WH490> she that was great <WH7227> among the nations, <WH1471> and princess <WH8282> among the provinces, <WH4082> how is she become <WH1961> tributary! <WH4522>

She weeps <WH1058> sore in the night, <WH3915> and her tears <WH1832> are on <WH5921> her cheeks: <WH3895> among all <WH3605> her lovers <WH157> she has none <WH369> to comfort <WH5162> her: all <WH3605> her friends <WH7453> have dealt treacherously <WH898> with her, they are become <WH1961> her enemies. <WH341>

Judah <WH3063> is gone into <WH1473> captivity <WH1540> because of affliction, <WH6040> and because of great <WH7230> servitude: <WH5656> she dwells <WH3427> among the heathen, <WH1471> she finds <WH4672> no <WH3808> rest: <WH4494> all <WH3605> her persecutors <WH7291> overtook <WH5381> her between <WH996> the straits. <WH4712>

The ways <WH1870> of Zion <WH6726> do mourn, <WH57> because none <WH1097> come <WH935> to the solemn <WH4150> feasts: <WH4150> all <WH3605> her gates <WH8179> are desolate: <WH8076> her priests <WH3548> sigh, <WH584> her virgins <WH1330> are afflicted, <WH3013> and she is in bitterness. <WH4843>

Her adversaries <WH6862> are the chief, <WH7218> her enemies <WH341> prosper; <WH7951> for the LORD <WH3068> has afflicted <WH3013> her for the multitude <WH7230> of her transgressions: <WH6588> her children <WH5768> are gone <WH1980> into captivity <WH7628> before <WH6440> the enemy. <WH6862>

And from the daughter <WH1323> of Zion <WH6726> all <WH3605> her beauty <WH1926> is departed: <WH3318> her princes <WH8269> are become <WH1961> like harts <WH354> that find <WH4672> no <WH3808> pasture, <WH4829> and they are gone <WH3212> without <WH3808> strength <WH3581> before <WH6440> the pursuer. <WH7291>

Jerusalem <WH3389> remembered <WH2142> in the days <WH3117> of her affliction <WH6040> and of her miseries <WH4788> all <WH3605> her pleasant <WH4262> things that she had <WH1961> in the days <WH3117> of old, <WH6924> when her people <WH5971> fell <WH5307> into the hand <WH3027> of the enemy, <WH6862> and none <WH369> did help <WH5826> her: the adversaries <WH6862> saw <WH7200> her, and did mock <WH7832> at <WH5921> her sabbaths. <WH4868>

Jerusalem <WH3389> has grievously <WH2399> sinned; <WH2398> therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> she is removed: <WH5206> all <WH3605> that honored <WH3513> her despise <WH2107> her, because <WH3588> they have seen <WH7200> her nakedness: <WH6172> yes, <WH1571> she sighs, <WH584> and turns <WH7725> backward. <WH268>

Her filthiness <WH2932> is in her skirts; <WH7757> she remembers <WH2142> not her last <WH319> end; therefore she came <WH3381> down <WH3381> wonderfully: <WH6382> she had no <WH369> comforter. <WH5162> O LORD, <WH3068> behold <WH7200> my affliction: <WH6040> for the enemy <WH341> has magnified <WH1431> himself.

The adversary <WH6862> has spread <WH6566> out his hand <WH3027> on all <WH3605> her pleasant <WH4261> things: for she has seen <WH7200> that the heathen <WH1471> entered <WH935> into her sanctuary, <WH4720> whom <WH834> you did command <WH6680> that they should not enter <WH935> into your congregation. <WH6951>

All <WH3605> her people <WH5971> sigh, <WH584> they seek <WH1245> bread; <WH3899> they have given <WH5414> their pleasant <WH4262> things for meat <WH400> to relieve <WH7725> the soul: <WH5315> see, <WH7200> O LORD, <WH3068> and consider; <WH5027> for I am become <WH1961> vile. <WH2151>

Is it nothing <WH3808> to you, all <WH3605> you that pass <WH5674> by? behold, <WH5027> and see <WH7200> if <WH518> there be any sorrow <WH4341> like to my sorrow, <WH4341> which <WH834> is done <WH5953> to me, with which <WH834> the LORD <WH3068> has afflicted <WH3013> me in the day <WH3117> of his fierce <WH2740> anger. <WH639>

From above <WH4791> has he sent <WH7971> fire <WH784> into my bones, <WH6106> and it prevails <WH7287> against them: he has spread <WH6566> a net <WH7568> for my feet, <WH7272> he has turned <WH7725> me back: <WH268> he has made <WH5414> me desolate <WH8076> and faint <WH1739> all <WH3605> the day. <WH3117>

The yoke <WH5923> of my transgressions <WH6588> is bound <WH8244> by his hand: <WH3027> they are wreathed, <WH8276> and come <WH5927> up on my neck: <WH6677> he has made my strength <WH3581> to fall, <WH3782> the LORD <WH136> has delivered <WH5414> me into their hands, <WH3027> from whom I am not able <WH3201> to rise <WH6965> up.

The LORD <WH136> has trodden <WH5541> under foot <WH5541> all <WH3605> my mighty <WH47> men in the middle <WH7130> of me: he has called <WH7121> an assembly <WH4150> against <WH5921> me to crush <WH7665> my young <WH970> men: the LORD <WH136> has trodden <WH1869> the virgin, <WH1330> the daughter <WH1323> of Judah, <WH3063> as in a wine press. <WH1660>

For these <WH428> things I weep; <WH1058> my eye, <WH5869> my eye <WH5869> runs <WH3381> down with water, <WH4325> because <WH3588> the comforter <WH5162> that should relieve <WH7725> my soul <WH5315> is far <WH7368> from me: my children <WH1121> are desolate, <WH8076> because <WH3588> the enemy <WH341> prevailed. <WH1396>

Zion <WH6726> spreads <WH6566> forth her hands, <WH3027> and there is none <WH369> to comfort <WH5162> her: the LORD <WH3068> has commanded <WH6680> concerning Jacob, <WH3290> that his adversaries <WH6862> should be round <WH5439> about him: Jerusalem <WH3389> is as a menstruous <WH5079> woman among <WH996> them.

The LORD <WH3068> is righteous; <WH6662> for I have rebelled <WH4784> against his commandment: <WH6310> hear, <WH8085> I pray <WH4994> you, all <WH3605> people, <WH5971> and behold <WH7200> my sorrow: <WH4341> my virgins <WH1330> and my young <WH970> men are gone <WH1980> into captivity. <WH7628>

I called <WH7121> for my lovers, <WH157> but they deceived <WH7411> me: my priests <WH3548> and my elders <WH2205> gave up the ghost <WH1478> in the city, <WH5892> while <WH3588> they sought <WH1245> their meat <WH400> to relieve <WH7725> their souls. <WH5315>

Behold, <WH7200> O LORD; <WH3068> for I am in distress: <WH6887> my bowels <WH4578> are troubled; <WH2560> my heart <WH3820> is turned <WH2015> within <WH7130> me; for I have grievously <WH4784> rebelled: <WH4784> abroad <WH2351> the sword <WH2719> bereaves, <WH7921> at home <WH1004> there is as death. <WH4194>

They have heard <WH8085> that I sigh: <WH584> there is none <WH369> to comfort <WH5162> me: all <WH3605> my enemies <WH341> have heard <WH8085> of my trouble; <WH7451> they are glad <WH7797> that you have done <WH6213> it: you will bring <WH935> the day <WH3117> that you have called, <WH7121> and they shall be like <WH3644> to me.

Let all <WH3605> their wickedness <WH7451> come <WH935> before <WH6440> you; and do <WH5953> to them, as you have done <WH5953> to me for all <WH3605> my transgressions: <WH6588> for my sighs <WH585> are many, <WH7227> and my heart <WH3820> is faint. <WH1742>
